title.narrative: Core Funding to OCHA & Red Cross

description.narrative: Core funding to Ireland’s main UN humanitarian coordination partner, the Office for the coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), and core funding to the Red Cross Movement (International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) and International Federation of the Red Cross (IFRC))

Under this budget line, Ireland will maintain the level of core funding to the main UN humanitarian coordination partner, the Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA). Under this budget line, Ireland will also continue to provide core funding to the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC), one of the most highly respected humanitarian agencies with an exceptional level of access to besieged or otherwise isolated populations in need of humanitarian assistance and also continue core support to the International Federation of the Red Cross (IFRC). Core funding to these organisations links to Ireland's Foreign Policy Objective 1 of Ireland’s Humanitarian Assistance Policy: To provide needs-based humanitarian assistance in a way that is predictable and flexible to respond to sudden onset, protracted and forgotten humanitarian crises.
